Not sure if this is the case with her, but there's a lot of controversy over the diagnosis of anorexia nervosa and weight. For instance, if you weighed 200 lb and lost 50 lb in a month or two, that would be extremely drastic and unhealthy. But, this person would still be 150lb and wouldn't be able to get a diagnosis of anorexia nervosa, or even be considered underweight.. This person would still be very malnourished and perhaps close to death.
My boyfriend does this by walking the dog in the middle of the night. He's out right now actually, 1am. He loves it.

Another thing similarly that I do is to do dishes while I wait for things like when i cook. If I need to microwave something for 5 minutes, instead of sitting down and waiting impatiently, I've decided I would be productive and get a few things clean. It's surprising how helpful this was for me! Even if its just a few dishes at a time. I feel like no time is wasted because it kind of double tasking.

WRITING.TITLE: Why does lamotrigine have to be so unpleasant to take?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm on 250mg of lamotrigine right now. So, I have to take one 200mg and half of a 100mg. That's fine but the 200s are just so big and icky that I have to break it into fourths to stop the feeling that its stuck in my throat, so I end up taking 5/4ths of a pill. Why can't it be tasty and sugary like adderall?
I do think brand name Lamictal has a better shape. I just hate these white circle ones that seem to be the exact shape of my throat or something. I know it's a minor issue but eck!

There was a study that asked college students to pick up some heavy object for x number of yards for $100 after being pepper sprayed and they all said yes and completed the task. The actual variables are more impressive to get a better idea but I don't remember. Point being is that both pepper spray and a crotch shot will probably only anger the dude even further. Definitely run at any chance, though.
The one time I saw it was at Tiffany's in New York a couple years ago, so I suppose there are some around still.

It seemed like he says he developed it because of the deaths, but schizophrenia generally is something a person is born with and just comes out with stressful events. Not trying to get unemotional and analytical, just interesting how he portrayed it as if the deaths almost gave him schizophrenia. I wasn't surprised though, from the first moment it looked like something was off about him, not just having a bad day. Reminds me of my schizophrenic uncle, who speaks a lot less, and definitely not about what would stress him out. I wonder if in this situation he would though.

Not true, at least not with all anosmics, people think taste and smell are more closely related than they are. Also, the experience between being born without a sense of smell and losing it is much different. I was born without a sense of smell and I can still very much taste things like chocolate, it isn't just sweet with some hints of bitter. But I can't really taste things like some spices.

You have so many responses, but if you do end up getting to this one...
I'm on the side of your SO. My boyfriend, who I knew has been addicted to stuff in the past, is addicted to GHB. He hid it from me for the first 2 years we've been together. I was upset for him hiding it, mostly, and I had no idea he had been doing it. He's even been passed out (really bad and strangely), but said it was from mixing alcohol and ambien (he has a prescription). If your SO is like me, you're more important than her knowing you're intoxicated. I was very upset for a week, maybe, and I have seen him differently, but I think that's to be expected. If you can handle knowing that, please tell her as soon as you feel it's okay.
You can even start with seeing a therapist first, as I wish my boyfriend did. He doesn't want to tell his psychiatrist and doesn't want to see a therapist because he's afraid of letting them down. I know he's trying really hard, but I'd be so much more proud of him for getting professional help. It'd mean a lot if you could do that.
I'm in the same boat. Love falling asleep thinking of her. Saw her today actually... Yay!

Really sorry to hear that. Similar time frame as my boyfriend. His dad died and a month later, his dog of 10 years died. Dad died of unknown circumstances so bf had a lot going on, and he only lived with his dog. The dog had a tumor in his brain and kept seizing and whimpering for a few days. Bfs snake died a couple months later. Bad year for him.

I usually let time pass longer than recommended, especially with teas that don't get bitter like mint tea. On the other hand, I'm very sensitive to bitterness in teas, and am really shocked when there's sweetness (I don't like it). I haven't tried different temperatures, though. I usually just use kettle-boiled water.

WRITING.TITLE: Does taste or smell draw you to tea more?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have no sense of smell (congenital anosmia). But, I love tea. I don't really like sweetened teas and strong tea flavors. I've heard that lacking a sense of smell can make my taste stronger, so maybe it's that, or perhaps it's the idea and culture behind tea that I love.
I honestly don't know if I'm just bullshitting myself into liking tea when sometimes tea tastes only slightly different than hot water.
Do you find that a lot of your enjoyment of tea is through smell? Just curious.

No... the shorter the better. Unless you fear fried ends and don't want your hair shorter. I only grew my hair out because it had been bleached and dyed black already.

Is it naturally black or dyed black? How long is it?
If its virgin short hair its a lot easier. I've had my hair all colors, but before I went white I grew out my hair for a while so it was virgin hair which makes it 100000x easier.
Try doing 2-3 bleachings with 20 developer. Wait a week in between. What I did was went light pink after my first bleaching so I didnt have icky orange hair. Dye bleached out rather quickly when it's pastel. Then about a month later, another bleach and it turned out pretty white. I used 30 developer. When you do bleach your hair, make sure it never dries out or else it stops working and just damages your hair.
For color, get the darkest purple you can find and mix it with conditioner. Check snakebitesparkles (I think that's her name.. google Melon lady) and she has a good tutorial and is very fun. Just youtube lavender hair, too.

okcupid is much cooler, in my opinion! good suggestion, though.
op: have you considered taking a class at a community college? it can seem very lonely in the beginning, but right now i'm actually making friends in my art classes. i'm going to class to transfer, but a lot off people are just taking it as is. slowly i've been making friends with similar interests as me. i'm going to santa monica college (in LA) and one class is less than $100. i definitely recommend an art class, even if you aren't an artist, because in my opinion people are much more willing to be social to everybody. might not be your thing, but it helped me.

Thanks for listening :)
I stopped going to therapy a few months ago because I was doing well, and my therapist agreed. Before I left, my boyfriend did come in with me because I was having trouble with the fact that he hid his addiction from me for 2 years.
I think the fact that he hasn't seen real consequences from it is hurting him. In addition to the drugs, his mom still helps him financially. I'm not sure on the specifics. I have never shared finances with him, though. I can't afford a place to stay without him, and being with my parents would be much more stressful. I do wish I could have a place to myself sometimes. This is especially so because of my lingering control issues (which was expressed as anorexia in the past) and I wish I could just have a clean house without anyone messing it up.
One of the things that he did see was the fact that I didn't want to have sex much anymore. We used to do some light bdsm, with him dominating, but I can't see that anymore when I can't respect him as much. I wasn't trying to withhold sex or anything, just loss of libido. I told him that I need him to work on everyday stuff, and he said he would try to, and did for very short time. So it seems like sex can motivate him (what guy wouldn't be?)
I'm afraid of becoming a nagging girlfriend. I remind him things, like getting his car fixed, but he just doesn't do it.
Your response helps just to make me feel like I do have the right to feel stressed (I don't act out on it). Thank you.

I have a few friends at TJs. Maybe I'll ask them if the rule is the same.

I switched pdocs because of the first was retarded, the second because of a switch in insurance. I'm also on the same meds (Lamictal and Zoloft specifically) and am doing well now, so I try not to worry about it too much.

Ah, I'm in the same boat! Decided to stop psychology and do art. Less morally stressful, I think. I'm also diagnosed with "Mood Disorder NOS" since I've just started seeing my 3rd psychiatrist. He basically told me that how I was feeling is more important than any diagnosis.
My first psychiatrist diagnosed me with depression, borderline personality, anorexia nervosa, adhd, generalized anxiety and panic disorder. my 2nd psychiatrist was probably just depression and anxiety, and my therapist said anorexia, ocd and depression. now it's just a "whatever". i also like to ask my boyfriend if he thinks i've been acting different and that helps a lot, to get an outside perspective. so if you live with someone you trust, that might be a good idea too.
I feel like knowing about how to diagnose and whatnot makes me feel like I'm "faking" a diagnosis for myself. It almost seems too easy to just lie and say I have x,y,z symptoms.

No, it was right after my 18th birthday but it was a few years of the same behavior.
Also I absolutely hated her.

My pdoc now does not think I have borderline but my 1st pdoc I had, who i hated, diagnosed me with it. So that's why I was put on lamictal right away, which was a good thing and helped with some aspects that might be borderline behavior. I'm only 20 so I can imagine some things I did when I was 16 could have been self destructing but because I was a teenager and I would've gotten over it.
I think medicine-wise I'm getting the treatment I need. I just recently changed pdocs (because insurance) but so far so good. It's just funny/confusing that I've gotten so many diagnoses that it ends up just being Mood Disorder NOS.
I hope you're doing better.

Yeah, I feel like I've never been given actual diagnoseses(?) that I'm okay with, like on a piece of paper. It'll be more like "Your social anxiety makes you blahblah" or something. I've seen 3 pdocs and 3 therapists and it's usually like that.
I know I definitely have depression, possibly double depression (lots of dysthymia) but I just don't know if I get hypomanic or it can just be irritability or mood changes due to other things.
It just almost makes me feel like I shouldn't need help if I don't have a specific diagnosis, but I know that's wrong.

i totally understand that feeling. i just end up doing that thing where you can not get the updates from the person. they can even be people close to me but i cannot stand updates about someone complaining about something. it just irritates me to no end because i try so hard to not post anything personal to my facebook. so i just end up becoming friends with them but just try my hardest to not look or communicate. i ignore lots of people though, not so good. but your brain will remember how you felt when this person was in your life, so it might not be the person specifically but where you were in life. like, imagine a time you were infatuated with a person and listening to a song. its the feeling that was important, not the person you were infatuated with.
so, with triggers, i just do my best to avoid the situations. i do also tell myself that rationally nothing will change in my life because i feel strong enough. it's a combination of both, i'm not sure if it's the healthiest but it has worked so far.
another thing right now that is happening is that people are staying at my house and my privacy is so limited and it makes me not want to leave my bedroom, thus i can't feed myself (anorexic) so i just have to push through it. i learned that in therapy. just push through your comfort zone. but it's been incredibly hard.

i'm a bit tired to understand (sorry if that's disrespectful) but i am on lamictal (antiseizure, for mood stabilizint) and zoloft which works great. also klonopin which i am thinking is also anticonvulsant qualities. pot is great since i also am anorexic, but it makes me dissociate more (definitely not as bad as pre-lamictal). i currently only smoke what i can get my hands on and i don't have much money to get a card (im in california) but i'm wondering if it's worth it. is there a certain strand i should look for? '
it isnt for seizures but more mood stabilizing for myself. are you saying pot is better for yourself? i ask because i am on anticonvulsants and i've read pot can also do the opposite. i'm not a frequent smoker but i am willing to try more if it can help. my only problem is the dissociation but that might just be because i deny my munchies (on accident). i also may be bipolar ii (well, mood disorder nos). i also have anxiety and ocd-ish. it's all a blur.

It's not me. I'm not even on Wellbutrin. It's for my boyfriend with a G addiction and is also on Wellbutrin. Apparently, when he increased in Wellbutrin dosages, it made the withdrawals from G worse (he's quitting now), so I think he stopped taking Wellbutrin. He's on Lamictal and Adderall now.

I was in the same position in the last few weeks. My boyfriend's niece is couchsurfing with her daughter (age is irrelevant in his family, we're young people who aren't used to lots of people around), and they were here for about 2 weeks. They are housesitting for us at the end of this month so I felt I needed to be extra polite. I didn't want to leave the room which made me not get food which made me more upset. I had some space because I'm also housesitting right now so I got to leave the house about half the time (I have a dog to take care of still) so that helped. I tried to look at the positive side of it which was that I don't think I acted as depressed while they were around, especially with her 11 year old daughter around. Although it's more comfortable to be by myself, I know that social anxiety is something I need to work on. Hope you're doing better. It's been a few days for me and I can definitely say I'm feeling better (I just switched meds too though, which is still good, probably some of both).

I didn't go to the last two burns (although I bought tickets) and this is my first year going. I'm going to ("just") community college, so it isn't a huge deal if I'm dropped, but I'm much more likely to get dropped. I've gotten responses from all the teachers except one.
I asked for advice from a head professor and he basically just said ask to not be dropped, and the best excuse is a family thing/wedding if they ask. Teachers didn't ask, but my work did. I don't think it's necessary to say more than that, unless you want to.

WRITING.TITLE: Prepaid phones?
WRITING.TEXT:
I was wondering if anyone has any information about prepaid phones.
My 2 year contract for my old phone ran out last month, so I'm pretty free to get anything. I was looking at iPhones, and came across articles about prepaid phones and how over time it saves you money. For those that don't know about it, this is what I know: You have to pay the full price of the phone (which might be as much as $600 or whatever, as opposed to the $99 with contract deals), but the monthly bill is $30-40, depending on the service. It's generally with unlimited data / text too. That's more important to me than minutes.
I went to a Sprint store and asked about it, and they explained that their prepaid service, Virgin Mobile, doesn't have as many towers so you get worse reception or something. I live in Los Angeles and wonder if that's very important, since I live in a big city and assume there are enough towers around.
Is it worth it? I only see articles about it being cheaper, but no first hand experiences.
Also, I'm in the market to buy a smartphone in general. I was specifically looking at the iPhone since I have a Macbook Pro. I know none of these options are the most frugal.
Edit: I am also looking at family plans to get a plan with my mom, but it doesn't look like smart phones have much savings for individual vs family plans, compared to the $10 per added line that we had previously. Any specific suggestions for that would be helpful, too.

I have two cards and I'm 20. I just applied for an Amazon credit card and had no problem. I got my first one a few years ago. I've had a debit card before that, and basically use the credit card in the same manner. I don't buy things that I know I don't have the money for, for instance.
